thread.title: Kai-Leon Herbert Flips Commitment from Michigan to Miami: Comments, Reaction
thread.title_full: Kai-Leon Herbert Flips Commitment from Michigan to Miami: Comments, Reaction

author: Scott Polacek
title: Kai-Leon Herbert Flips Commitment from Michigan to Miami: Comments, Reaction
text: Kai-Leon Herbert Flips Commitment from Michigan to Miami: Comments, Reaction Photo Credit: Scout Scott Polacek Featured Columnist January 26, 2017 Offensive lineman Kai-Leon Herbert decommitted from the University of Michigan's 2017 recruiting class on Sunday, per Corey Bender of Scout, and chose his new school on Wednesday. Herbert tweeted that he will attend the University of Miami: Kai-Leon Herbert @KHerb17 Blessed beyond measure to announce that I HAVE OFFICIALLY COMMITTED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MIAMIğŸ™ŒğŸ¾ğŸ™ŒğŸ¾ğŸ™ŒğŸ¾â€¼ï¸ God got us from here on out . https://t.co/CxW6OqzDUH Herbert checks in at 6'4 Â½" and 284 pounds and is a 4-star recruit, per Scout . He is the No. 257 overall prospect, No. 26 offensive tackle and No. 5 offensive tackle from the state of Florida in his class. More to follow.
